content: Prioritize accuracy, clarity, eloquence, and brevity. Ask questions and suggest interesting ideas when appropriate.
how to git add . and commit in same line

You can use the following command to add all changes and commit them in the same line:

```
git commit -am "commit message"
```

The `-a` option adds all changes, and the `-m` option allows you to specify the commit message in the same line. Note that this command will only work if the files you want to commit have already been tracked by Git.
how to also add new files

To add new files and commit them in the same line, you can use the following command:

```
git commit -am "commit message" --include-untracked
```

The `--include-untracked` option adds all changes, including newly created files that are not yet tracked by Git.

However, please note that it is generally recommended to review your changes before committing them, especially if you are adding new files. You can use the `git status` command to see which files have changed, and use `git add` to stage specific files before committing them.
